ygData.msgSnippet: ... I realised that after I sent it, sorry :) ... my ... do ... numbers ... involved ... point ... The best fix would be in the game itself, where teleporters

From: "Storey" <storey@...>

> DPH's TevFifty?? Might you mean Tevildo's TevFifty?
I realised that after I sent it, sorry :)

> <<Tevildo:
> Alrighty, since I know how valuable feedback is I might as well throw in
my
> 2 cents worth :) I went through the levels with a Cleric (Yes that is 'a',
> as in 1, I find any computer controlled characters run off and die...). I
do
> not know if it was a legit cleric, I remember long ago playing around with
> values to see what happened, and I hadn't played since then, but the
numbers
> for stats seemed just a little high :)
> I made it through, there were a few annoying levels, many of which
involved
> the "No you can't go through that teleporter, there is something on the
> other side" problem, which isn't anything you can fix easily :( >>
>
> No, the only way to fix that was to increase the hallway width to the
point
> where it won't fit on the map anymore.
The best fix would be in the game itself, where teleporters act like those
in quake, and squish (kill) whatever is on the other side :)

> <<Lets see:
> The stairs levels, very well designed, but utterly confusing as to where
> they went, I ran around them for ages, and ages and ages, it was difficult
> to tell which way I was supposed to be going to go up or down to the next
> level/flight.  It was also difficult to navigate on foot, slightly wider
> pathways would help immensely (if possible).  I remember finally
abondoning
> going up to the top, or whatever was supposed to be at the end, as going
> round in circles is not my idea of progress :)>>
>
> That was supposed to be confusing. Endless staircases climbing into the
sky?
> Weird. Confusing. Solution? Have your cleric summon a ghost.
Yeah I did that, it got over the single levels, but I still couldn't get to
the top of the 'chain' (assuming there is one :), also I found that only a
small number of monsters could actually be summoned as ghosts, if the pile
of blood wasn't very close to the center of the hallway I couldn't summon
anything from it.

> The problem
> with wider pathways is that there wouldn't be enough room  between
flights,
> and the NPCs would stand slightly off-center on the teleporter, never
coming
> through but still blocking.
Wider as in a few pixels wider, it's almost wide enough, also makes hand to
hand combat hard (but thats another game problem...).  It's quite ok as it
is though :)

> <<The ocean without a boat scenario, I tried to play it but it only ever
> took 1 hit to kill me.  I'm not sure if this is the way the level was
> designed (ie - super-powerful monsters) or it was something to do with the
> game and being over the ocean.  An exit from that level would also be
nice,
> I couldn't see one on the minimap, and I thought it might be a good idea
to
> include a link back to the dock you stepped off, we are swimming right?
Just
> turn around and swim back :) >>
>
> Well, I originally planned to end my set with something unbeatable, but
then
> I decided that would be too depressing so I stuck it on the side. It
really
> is unbeatable, unless you're doing something very wrong. there is an exit
> but it's very well hidden ; ).
Ah, well I obviously didn't last long enough to find it then :)  I managed
to kill one of the monsters, just not getting hit was difficult.

Cya,
Deathifier (David Storey)
